alert.note: Alert for Clay; Fillmore; Greeley; Hamilton; Howard; Merrick; Nance; Nuckolls; Polk; Sherman; Thayer; Valley; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 08 at 3:36AM CST until January 09 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM TODAY INTO TUESDAY MORNING WITH BLIZZARD CONDITIONS LIKELY AT TIMES... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations mainly between 6 and 10 inches, except for the Mitchell County Kansas area where slightly lower amounts are favored. North winds gusting as high as 35 to 45 MPH starting mainly late this afternoon into tonight. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and central, east central, and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...From 6 AM this morning to 9 AM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread falling and eventually blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility to around 1/2 mile at times, especially in open, rural areas, creating near-blizzard conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact especially the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation could start as rain or sleet this morning especially near and south of the Kansas border, but should change to snow within a few hours for most areas. Although much of the area will see moderate to heavy snow begin this morning, the strongest winds and most likely time frame for possible near-blizzard conditions will not occur until late this afternoon into tonight, when north winds increase and gust as high as 40 to 50 MPH. The majority of snow will fall today into this evening, but lingering lighter snow and strong winds will continue into Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
